title: Hingalganj (Vidhan Sabha constituency)
text:
Hingalganj (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is an <a href="Vidhan%20Sabha">assembly</a> constituency in <a href="North%2024%20Parganas%20district">North 24 Parganas district</a> in the <a href="India">India</a>n <a href="States%20and%20territories%20of%20India">state</a> of <a href="West%20Bengal">West Bengal</a>. It is reserved for <a href="Scheduled%20castes%20and%20scheduled%20tribes">scheduled castes</a>.
Overview.
As per orders of the <a href="Delimitation%20Commission%20of%20India">Delimitation Commission</a>, 126 Hingalganj (Vidhan Sabha constituency) (SC) is composed of the following: <a href="Hingalganj">Hingalganj</a> <a href="Community%20Development%20Block%20in%20India">community development block</a>, and Barunhat Rameshwarpur, Bhabanipur I, Bhabanipur II, Hasnabad, PatliKhanpur <a href="gram%20panchayat">gram panchayat</a>s of <a href="Hasnabad%20%28community%20development%20block%29">Hasnabad</a> community development block, and Khulna gram panchayat of <a href="Sandeshkhali%20II">Sandeshkhali II</a> community development block.
Hingalganj (Vidhan Sabha constituency) is part of 18. <a href="Basirhat%20%28Lok%20Sabha%20constituency%29">Basirhat (Lok Sabha constituency)</a>.
Election results.
2021.
In the 2021 election,Debesh Mondal of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival, Nemai Das of BJP.
2016.
In the 2016 election,Debesh Mondal of Trinamool Congress defeated his nearest rival, Anandamoy Mondal of CPI.
2011.
In the 2011 election, Anandamoy Mondal of CPI defeated his nearest rival Debesh Mondal of Trinamool Congress,
2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2011 assembly elections</a>, Anandamoy mondal of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI</a> won the 99 Hingalganj (SC) assembly seat defeating his nearest rival Debes Mandal of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Debes Mandal lost second time from this assembly.
1977-2006.
In the <a href="2006%20West%20Bengal%20state%20assembly%20election">2006 assembly elections</a>, Gopal Gayen of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India%20%28Marxist%29">CPI(M)</a> won the 99 Hingalganj (SC) assembly seat defeating his nearest rival Debes Mandal of <a href="All%20India%20Trinamool%20Congress">Trinamool Congress</a>. Contests in most years were multi cornered but only winners and runners are being mentioned. Nripen Gayen of CPI(M) defeated Sourendra Mondal of Trinamool Congress in 2001, Bidyut Kayal of <a href="Indian%20National%20Congress">Congress</a> in 1996 and Sankar Roy of Congress in 1991. Sudhanshu Mondal of CPI(M) defeated Aditya Mondal of Congress in 1987 and Amal Krishna Mistry representing Congress in 1982 and representing <a href="Janata%20Party">Janata Party</a> in 1977.
1967-1972.
Anil Chandra Mondal of <a href="Communist%20Party%20of%20India">CPI</a> won in 1972. Gopal Chandra Gayen of CPI(M) won in 1971. Hazari Lal Mondal of CPI won in 1969. B.N. Brahmachari of Independent won in 1967. Prior to that the Hingalganj seat was not there.
